GDELT.Actor2Geo_Fullname: London, London, City of, United Kingdom

ARTICLE.TITLE: Drug-addled shoplifter unleashes 'torrent of vile abuse' and bites man after trying to steal washing up liquid at Stoke-on-Trent shop
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Want Stoke-on-Trent news emailed to you direct from our journalists? Sign up to our newsletter Subscribe Thank you for subscribing See our privacy notice Invalid Email

Drug addict James Wallbank bit a man on his wrist and arm after he was caught shoplifting.

A shop assistant approached the 41-year-old after she caught him attempting to steal washing up liquid inside McColl's on Leek Road, Hanley.

He then launched a 'torrent of vile abuse' at the female worker who called the police on November 28.

Two members of the public helped to restrain Wallbank until the police arrived, but one of the men was bitten.

Stoke-on-Trent Crown Court heard that Wallbank committed a total of seven theft offences in November.

Get alerts of the latest news from our courts Want a free daily bulletin - plus breaking news alerts direct to your inbox? Then sign up to our email newsletter service by clicking here. Or you can type your email address into the 'sign up to free daily alerts' box. It's at the top of this article. Click 'subscribe' and you can expect your first newsletter at the next release.

On November 11 he stole three bottles of vodka from Asda, in Bucknall, and a kitchen knife was found in his bag.

A week later on November 18, he was caught stealing from the same Asda again and Lloyds Pharmacy in Bucknall.

He then stole from the Werrington Road supermarket twice on November 20 and committed two more thefts from the store on November 25 and 26.

Now Wallbank has been sentenced to 22 months, but he will be detained at North London Priory Hospital instead of prison under section 45A of The Mental Health Act.

The court heard that Wallbank, formerly of City Road, Fenton, suffers with a mental disorder due to his drug use.

Judge Paul Glenn said: "You're 41, you have many convictions, you are a prolific offender. You have a lot of offending, no doubt linked to drug use.

"On November 11 you stole three bottles of vodka and you were confronted. A knife was found in your bag, you were carrying a large kitchen knife.

"On November 28 you attempted to steal washing up liquid and you were approached by a female shop assistant who told you to put it back.

"You looked at her and made a torrent of vile abuse and when the police arrived she was really shaken up. Two males restrained you, you bit him on the arm and made disgusting comments towards him.

"He sustained a bite mark on his wrist and right bicep. When interviewed you made admissions. You have five previous like offences and a history of violent offending under the influence of drink and or drugs.

"You were remanded in custody and transferred to North London Priory Hospital. You have a long standing history of drug abuse, your behaviour in the community and in the hospital has been a cause for significant concern.

"You suffer from a mental disorder due to your multiple drug use, you have a personality disorder with traits of emotionally unstable personality.

"The recommendation is to make a hybrid order under section 45A of The Mental Health Act and you will be detained in hospital to continue your treatment."

The judge ordered the forfeiture and destruction of the knife.

METADATA.description: James Wallbank committed seven theft offences in one month
METADATA.author: Ruby Davies

og.title: Shoplifter bites man after trying to steal washing up liquid from shop
og.description: James Wallbank committed seven theft offences in one month
